sections.title: Christian Life
sections.bibleVerse: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.
text: Who is a Christian?
A Christian is someone who:
Believes in and follows Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior.
Core Beliefs:
• Jesus is the Son of God, who lived a sinless life, died for our sins, & rose again (1 Corinthians 15:3–4).
• Salvation is by grace through faith, not earned by good works (Ephesians 2:8–9).
• The Bible is God’s inspired Word, the foundation for belief and practice (2 Timothy 3:16).
• Christians strive to live like Jesus, loving God and loving others (Matthew 22:37–39).
In Practice:
• A Christian has a personal relationship with God through Jesus.
• They repent of sin, trust in Christ’s sacrifice, and walk in obedience.
• They become part of the body of Christ, the global family of believers.
Simply put:
A Christian is a forgiven sinner, made new by Christ, and committed to following Him.

children.title: Alter Call
text: Heavenly Father,
I come to You today just as I am.
I confess that I am a sinner, and I need Your forgiveness.
I believe that Jesus Christ is Your Son,
That He died for my sins and rose again on the third day.
Lord Jesus, I open the door of my heart to You.
Come into my life. Be my Lord and my Savior.
Wash me clean. Make me new.
Fill me with Your Holy Spirit and lead me every day.
Today, I turn away from my old life,
And I choose to follow You.
Give me strength to walk in Your truth,
To love You, and to live for You all the days of my life.
Thank You, Lord, for saving me.
Thank You for making me a child of God.
In Jesus’ name I pray,
Amen.

children.title: Serenity Prayer
text: God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change,
Courage to change the things I can,
And wisdom to know the difference.
Living one day at a time, enjoying one moment at a time;
Accepting hardship as a pathway to peace;
Taking, as Jesus did, this sinful world as it is, not as I would have it;
Trusting that You will make all things right if I surrender to Your will;
So that I may be reasonably happy in this life and supremely happy with You forever in the next.
Amen.

children.title: Early Morning Declaration
text: Dear Lord,
1. Thank you for the breath in my lungs this morning
2. Thank you for waking me up & giving me another chance at life
3. Thank you for this morning fluid (coffee/water), and the roof over my head
4. I’m sorry God for any and everything that I take for granted on a daily basis
5. Please posture my heart to see all the good, the grace, and purposes of today’s events
6. Protect me today; replacing anxiety with peace and worry with your joy, flesh with spirit, indiscipline with discipline
7. Blanket me in your strength as you fight my battles for me today
8. Blood of Jesus, redeem my destiny and separate me from all ancestral yokes
9. Wherever I go, whomever I speak to, let your favor cover me and speak for me always

children.title: Life Principles To Live By
text: 1. Our intimacy with God—His highest priority for our lives—determines the impact of our lives.
2. Obey God and leave all the consequences to Him.
3. God’s Word is an immovable anchor in times of storm.
4. The awareness of God’s presence energizes us for our work.
5. God does not require us to understand His will, just obey it, even if it seems unreasonable.
6. You reap what you sow, more than you sow, and later than you sow.
7. The dark moments of our life will last only so long as is necessary for God to accomplish His purpose in us.
8. Fight all your battles on your knees and you win every time.
9. Trusting God means looking beyond what we can see to what God sees.
10. If necessary, God will move heaven and earth to show us His will.
11. God assumes full responsibility for our needs when we obey Him.
12. Peace with God is the fruit of oneness with God.
13. Listening to God is essential to walking with God.
14. God acts on behalf of those who wait for Him.
15. Brokenness is God’s requirement for maximum usefulness.
